form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Klobuchar (for herself, Mr. Hoeven, and Mr. Johnson of South Dakota) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a consumer renewable credit for a utility that sells renewable power, and for other purposes.

paragraph.text: Subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

subsection.text: For purposes of section 38, in the case of an eligible taxpayer, the consumer renewable credit for any taxable year is an amount equal to the product of—

paragraph.text: the renewable portfolio factor of such eligible taxpayer, and
subject to subsection (e), the number of kilowatt hours of renewable electricity—

subparagraph.text: purchased or produced by such taxpayer, and
sold by such taxpayer to a retail customer during the taxable year.

subsection.text: In the case of taxable years beginning before January 1, 2019, the renewable portfolio factor for an eligible taxpayer shall be determined as follows:

row.entry: At least 6 percent but less than 8 percent
At least 8 percent but less than 12 percent
At least 12 percent but less than 16 percent
At least 16 percent but less than 20 percent
At least 20 percent but less than 24 percent
Equal to or greater than 24 percent

paragraph.text: The term eligible taxpayer means an electric utility, as defined in section 3(22) of the Federal Power Act (16 U.S.C. 796(22)).
The term renewable electricity means electricity generated by any facility using wind or solar energy to generate such electricity.

The term renewable electricity percentage means the percentage of an eligible taxpayer’s total sales of electricity to retail customers which is derived from renewable electricity (determined without regard to whether such electricity was produced by the taxpayer).
For purposes of this section, rules similar to the rules of paragraphs (1), (3), and (5) of section 45(e) shall apply.

paragraph.header: Credit allowed only with respect to one eligible entity
paragraph.text: No credit shall be allowed under subsection (a) with respect to renewable electricity purchased from another eligible entity if a credit has been allowed under this section to such other eligible entity.

subsection.text: The amount of the credit determined under this section with respect to any electricity shall be reduced to take into account any payment provided with respect to such electricity solely by reason of the application of section 6433.

paragraph.text: In the case of renewable electricity generated by a wind or solar energy facility which is located on an Indian reservation (as defined in section 168(j)(6)), the number of kilowatt hours of such renewable electricity shall, for purposes of subsection (a)(2), be equal to 200 percent of the kilowatt hours of such renewable electricity actually purchased or produced and sold during the taxable year.

In the case of renewable electricity generated by a wind or solar energy facility which is wholly owned by a mutual or cooperative electric company (as described in section 501(c)(12) or 1381(a)(2)(C)), the number of kilowatt hours of such renewable electricity shall, for purposes of subsection (a)(2), be equal to 150 percent of the kilowatt hours of such renewable electricity actually purchased or produced and sold during the taxable year.

paragraph.header: Credit made part of general business credit
paragraph.text: Subsection (b) of section 38 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking plus at the end of paragraph (35), by striking the period at the end of paragraph (36) and inserting , plus, and by adding at the end the following new paragraph:
the consumer renewable credit determined under section 45S(a).

Subparagraph (B) of section 38(c)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by redesignating clauses (vii) through (ix) as clauses (viii) through (x), respectively, and by inserting after clause (v) the following new clause:
The table of sections for subpart D of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new item:
Subchapter B of chapter 65 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

subsection.text: If any eligible person sells renewable electricity to a retail customer, the Secretary shall pay (without interest) to any such person who elects to receive a payment an amount equal to the product of—

paragraph.text: the intermittent renewable portfolio factor of such eligible person, and
the number of kilowatt hours of renewable electricity—

subparagraph.text: purchased or produced by such person, and
sold by such person in the trade or business of such person to a retail customer.

paragraph.text: Except as provided in paragraph (2), rules similar to the rules of section 6427(i)(1) shall apply for purposes of this section.

subparagraph.text: If, at the close of any quarter of the taxable year of any person (or, in the case of an eligible person that does not have a taxable year, the close of any quarter of the fiscal year), at least $750 is payable in the aggregate under subsection (a), to such person with respect to electricity purchased or produced during—

clause.text: any prior quarter (for which no other claim has been filed) during such year,

subparagraph.continuation-text: a claim may be filed under this section with respect to such electricity.

subparagraph.text: No claim filed under this paragraph shall be allowed unless filed on or before the last day of the first quarter following the earliest quarter included in the claim.

paragraph.text: The term eligible person means—

subparagraph.text: an electric utility, as defined in section 3(22) of the Federal Power Act (16 U.S.C. 796(22)), or
a Federal power marketing agency, as defined in section 3(19) of such Act (16 U.S.C. 796(19)).

paragraph.text: Any term used in this section which is also used in section 45S shall have the meaning given such term under section 45S.
For purposes of this section, rules similar to the rules of paragraphs (1) and (3) of section 45(e) shall apply.

subsection.header: Payment disallowed unless amount passed to third-Party generators charged for integration costs

paragraph.text: In the case of renewable electricity eligible for the payment under subsection (a) that is purchased and not produced by an eligible person, no payment shall be made under this section unless any charge the eligible person has assessed the seller to recover the integration costs associated with such electricity has been reduced (but not below zero) to the extent of the payment received under subsection (a) associated with such electricity.

For purposes of paragraph (1), charges intended to recover integration costs do not include amounts paid by the producer of the electricity for interconnection facilities, distribution upgrades, network upgrades, or stand alone network upgrades as those terms have been defined by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission in its Standard Interconnection Procedures.

subsection.header: Payment allowed for special generating and transmitting entities

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding subsection (a)(2), a special generating and transmitting entity shall be eligible for payment under subsection (a) based on the number of kilowatt hours of renewable electricity transmitted, regardless of whether such entity purchased or sold such electricity to retail customers.
For purposes of this subsection, the term special generating and transmitting entity means—

clause.text: provides transmissions services for greater than 4,000 megawatts of renewable electricity generating facilities, as determined by reference to the machine or nameplate capacity thereof, and
transmits the majority of such renewable electricity to customers located outside of the region that it serves, or

subparagraph.text: a generation and transmission cooperative which engages primarily in providing wholesale electric services to its members (generally consisting of distribution cooperatives).

paragraph.text: The table of sections for subpart B of chapter 65 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new item:

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to electricity produced or purchased and sold after December 31, 2013, and before January 1, 2019.

section.header: Delay in application of worldwide interest

subsection.text: Paragraphs (5)(D) and (6) of section 864(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are each amended by striking “December 31, 2020” and inserting “December 31, 2022”.
The amendments made by this section shall take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
